title: Mathematics Education Design Strategies Applying Cognitive Load Theory

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of intermediate-level courses in related fields or equivalent experience
context.additional_context: A practice-focused course for pre-service and in-service teachers to acquire strategies for minimizing cognitive load when designing mathematics educational materials.

learning_goals: Learners will explain the three elements of Cognitive Load Theory (intrinsic, extraneous, germane load) and apply them to mathematics instructional design.
Learners will design instructional materials that reduce extraneous cognitive load by over 30% by integrating visual aids, text, and audio explanations when explaining mathematical concepts.
Learners will develop educational scenarios that systematically break down complex mathematical problem-solving processes into steps using the Part-Whole Learning technique.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
